name: 國際企業管理研究
goals: Learn the fundamental theories and practices of international business management
Understand how culture and diversity influence international business management
Understand the various issues, opportunities, and challenges of international business management in global environment
Understand the importance of social and ethical responsibility of international businesses
Understand strategic planning and implementation on human resource management for international businesses
syllabus:
Week 1

Course Introduction, Syllabus Review

Week 2

Globalization and IM

Week 3

National differences and IM

Week 4

Institutional context of IM

Week 5

Ethical and social responsibility challenges

Week 6

Strategic management content & formulation

Week 7

Multinational and participation strategies

Week 8

IM for small business and entrepreneurship

Week 9

IHRD Conference

Week 10

Organizational design and strategic alliances of MNCs

Week 11

Technology, knowledge management and new business models for MNCs

Week 12

International HRM

Week 13

HRM and localization issues

Week 14

Multinational Management Project Presentation

Week 15

International negotiation and communication

Week 16

Motivation in MNCs

Week 17

Leadership and management in MNCs

Week 18

Final Exam

methodologies.note: Text book, PowerPoint slides and video clips will be used to introduce the topics relevant to international business management
Students will be divided into groups. Each group will discuss assigned cases derived from textbook and present their answers to the whole class for class discussion.
Students will collaborate on a group project to analyze the feasibility of an international business venture.
Students will complete a group project report to analyze the feasibility of an international business venture.

grading.note: At the end of the semester, a final exam will be given to evaluate students’ comprehension of the course materials. The test format will include multiple choice and short essay questions.
Students are expected to attend each class, prepare discussed readings and assignments and actively participate in class discussions.
Class attendance is required. Please come to the class on time and notify the instructor ahead of time if you will be late or absent for a class.
Case analysis report for integrating cases will be assigned as a group project. Each group will present an integrating case and their answers to case questions in class.

Students will complete a group project report to analyze the feasibility of a multinational venture project. The outcome of this project will be a comparative management paper, which thoroughly analyzes and discusses cultural, organizational, and management characteristics of another country. The paper must include a comparison of these characteristics to those of Taiwan. The grade for this project depends on the in class presentation and the written report.

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
